channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Windows 11's New Start Menu Is Back
item.dc:creator: Corbin Davenport
item.description: Will it actually roll out to everyone this time?
item.content:encoded: Microsoft is testing a revamped Start Menu for Windows 11, starting in the Canary Channel for Insiders. It’s much larger than the previous design, and it will hopefully require less scrolling or searching to find the apps you need.

item.title: Home Assistant and iPhone Critical Alerts Are a Match Made in Heaven
item.dc:creator: Adam Davidson
item.content:encoded: Some iPhone apps can use critical alerts to bypass your iPhone's settings and play audible notifications even when your iPhone is in Silent mode or Do Not Disturb focus. Using Home Assistant, it's possible to send bespoke critical alerts for any reason that you want.

item.title: Intel’s Core Ultra Series 3 Processors Will Have a Few Surprises
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.description: Some good, some not so much.
item.content:encoded: We're fast approaching the end of the year, and as it's usually the case, we're starting to see the stuff that will power our hardware next year. Intel's Core Ultra Series 3 is finally here, and there's a few things you should know.

item.title: This EcoFlow Power Station Could 'Overheat and Ignite' Without a Firmware Update
item.dc:creator: Corbin Davenport
item.description: If you have an EcoFlow Delta Max 2000 Power Station, install the latest firmware update now.
item.content:encoded: EcoFlow has announced a recall of its Delta Max 2000 power stations, due to a problem that caused some units to “overheat and ignite.” You don’t have to return or mail the power station, though—you just need to install a firmware update.

item.title: Don't Overlook the Remote When Buying Your Next TV
item.dc:creator: Aran Folsom
item.description: Minor oversights can have major repercussions.
item.content:encoded: The time has finally come to replace your old TV. You've checked every spec down to the nit count, but have you thought about the remote? Is it missing essential features, or is it so feature-packed that you're left fumbling to find that one rarely-used yet super-important button? Is it compatible with the rest of your entertainment system? How easy will it be to replace if you don't want an aftermarket duplicate?

item.title: Here's How I Removed the Annoying Search Icons from My Windows 11 Taskbar
item.dc:creator: Aman Kumar
item.description: Keep only what you need on the taskbar.
item.content:encoded: The search bar on the Windows 11 taskbar allows you to quickly search for apps and files available on your device. If you're connected to the internet, you will also notice a small icon in the taskbar's search bar that changes every day. If you're like me and prefer the search bar to be free of any such icon, there are a few ways to disable it.

item.content:encoded: Don't miss out on these last-minute deals!

item.title: Over-the-Air TV With DRM Might Need New Laws, Says FCC
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: The legal future of ATSC 3.0 and NextGen TV is up in the air.
item.content:encoded: The FCC has just dropped a huge, 69-page draft ruling that directly tackles the fight against Digital Rights Management (DRM) on over-the-air television. Honestly, it's surprising that a draft rulemaking was released at all, considering the US government is currently shut down.

item.title: Make Your First Graphical Python App: Getting Started With Tkinter
item.dc:creator: Zunaid Ali
item.description: Why write text-only applications when flashy graphical ones are so easy in Python?
item.content:encoded: Creating programming projects is great. But if it has a graphical interface? Even better! Building a GUI application has many perks. You end up with something even non-techie friends can appreciate. That's why we're going to make a Python GUI application and learn the Tkinter library in the process.

item.title: Vivaldi 7.6 Brings Reader Mode to iPhone and Android
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: A few much needed features have been added to the iPhone and Android apps.
item.content:encoded: Vivaldi 7.6 is officially out on mobile platforms, and this update brings some much-needed features to iOS and Android. Vivaldi’s latest release brings in reader mode, better tab management, and that polish under the hood that makes browsing much smoother.
